duties_responsibilities.duty: Direct operations, programs, and activities to meet organizational and regulatory requirements and to drive innovation.
Ensure adequate and qualified staffing for the department through hiring, orientation, training, and performance management.
Develop and recognize staff through coaching and regular feedback. Set and execute department strategies to meet various goals.
Oversee the financial operation for the laboratory by monitoring resource utilization and identifying variances.
Assure compliance with standards set forth by accrediting agencies (CAP, JCAHO, CLIA, FDA, and CMS). Develop and implement policies and procedures.
Manage key vendor relationships and supply contracts. Develop and implement a communication plan to ensure that department personnel are well-informed.
Direct and organize operations through appropriate delegation of responsibilities and authority. Monitor and evaluate the activities of the staff and provide management, coaching, and guidance.
Ensure operational efficiency and adherence to policies and procedures.
Evaluate and incorporate feedback into the department improvement and planning process.

education_certification.credential: Baccalaureate Degree in Medical Technology, Biomedical Science, Biology, or Chemistry required. Master’s Degree preferred. National Certification as a Medical Technologist required. State license where required (CA, FL, GA, HI, LA, MT, NV, NY, ND, RI, TN, WV).
